metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5590 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the phar_fix_filepath function in ext/phar/phar.c in PHP before 5.4.43, 5.5.x before 5.5.27, and 5.6.x before 5.6.11 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via a large length value, as demonstrated by mishandling of an e-mail attachment by the imap PHP extension.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5590` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-cli - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-common - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-curl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-enchant - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-fpm - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-gd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13

php5-ldap - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-mysql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-mysqlnd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-odbc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-pgsql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-pspell - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13

No subscription required

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13').
